intro: Atriplex atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama saltbush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Chile and Peru. It is characterized by its succulent leaves, which are adapted to retain moisture in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. Its salt-tolerant nature makes it well-suited for coastal and saline soils. Atriplex atacamensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife in its native range.
